intro: Randia buchananii, commonly known as the Caribbean starfruit or yellow starvine, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its trailing growth habit, opposite leaves, and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. Its fruit, which resembles a starfruit, is edible and has a tangy, acidic flavor. Randia buchananii is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and unique fruit.
